Albania: Albanian leader Ali Pashë Tepelena was assassinated by Ottoman agents for promoting an autonomous state.
Brazil: Brazil gains independence. (Dia do Fico) Prince Pedro of Brazil proclaims the Brazilian independence on 7 September. On 1 December, he is crowned as Emperor Dom Pedro I of Brazil.
Burma: Burmese put down another rebellion in Assam, and make it a Burmese province
Chile: The Chilean Constitution of 1822 comes into effect.
Haiti: Boyer arrives in Santo Domingo and declares control over the entire island of Hispaniola
Singapore: Raffles drafts the Raffles Plan of Singapore to reorganise the island.
Tanzania: United Kingdom signs a treaty with Sultan Seyyid Said to begin the abolition of slavery in Zanzibar.
